testCase.expectations:
- titles should look like these: "Programação","Ciência da Computação","Desenvolvimento Web","Engenharia de Software"
      - all titles and descriptions in Brazilian Portuguese

      
  - The main focus is the `title` field, no need to pay much attention to the `description` field
  - No level/joiner words like "basic", "intermediate", "advanced", "fundamentals", etc
  - No words like "course" in the title
  - Titles are always in Title Case

steps.conclusion: None.

Several titles misuse Title Case for Brazilian Portuguese by capitalizing the preposition "de" (e.g., "Desenvolvimento De Software", "Desenvolvimento De Aplicativos Móveis", "Estruturas De Dados"), which should be lowercase as in the provided examples. All descriptions are one sentence and in Portuguese, and there are no joiners in titles.

Fix title capitalization to "Desenvolvimento de Software", "Desenvolvimento de Aplicativos Móveis", and "Estruturas de Dados" to match expected style. For a vague input like "I want to code", consider also including canonical broad fields such as "Ciência da Computação" and "Engenharia de Software" as shown in expectations. Optionally broaden coverage with related single-topic suggestions like "Banco de Dados" or "Arquitetura de Software" while keeping titles clean and in proper case.

Possible minor style/format issues: (1) The title “British Invasion And Its Legacy” uses “And,” which may conflict with the guidance to avoid joiners for single-topic titles. (2) Some titles capitalize short words (Of, And, For), which may be seen as nonstandard Title Case, though the instruction is not strict about style rules. (3) Using “Beatles” instead of the more canonical “The Beatles” is acceptable per expectations but slightly less standard.

Consider renaming “British Invasion And Its Legacy” to a single-topic phrasing without a joiner, e.g., “British Invasion” or “British Invasion Legacy.” Use “The Beatles” as the main title for greater canonical accuracy. Several minor French phrasing/grammar issues: 1) Title "Suspensions Automobile" should be "Suspension Automobile" or "Suspensions Automobiles". 2) "Gestion De Données En Course" is awkward; "Gestion Des Données De Course" or "Gestion Des Données En Course" would be more idiomatic. 3) The description for "Formule 1" is slightly awkward ("dans le sport automobile de Formule 1"); "dans la Formule 1" would be smoother. Otherwise, titles are in Title Case per instruction and descriptions are single sentences.

Polish French phrasing as noted; consider adding a broad alternative like "Sport Automobile" to cover the domain more generally; optionally include highly relevant related topics such as "Stratégie De Course", "Télémetrie Et Analyse De Performance", or "Ingénierie Des Monoplaces". Tighten descriptions to emphasize learner value more crisply.
